feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by deducting them from the working days total. Once an unpaid leave request is approved, the system automatically generates and reflects the corresponding pay deduction on the payroll table. The feature supports both calendar day-based and working day-based leave policies.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages to determine salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts with greater control over calculation methodology.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations, including selection of salary components and calculation methods.
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and payroll settings
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee before daily pay deduction can be calculated and reflected
Company public holiday calendar must be configured to exclude weekends and public holidays from working days calculations.
User must have super admin role to access and configure the Daily Wage Calculator.
Access to Leave Settings configuration as a Super Admin; ability to add a new leave policy
Super admin access to payroll settings; active payroll system with employee records

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, leave policy type (calendar days or working days), and approved unpaid leave days
Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).

Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), selection of calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and configuration of eligible leave types for encashment.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, reflected on the payroll table, and calculated daily pay rate used for the deduction
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and determines which salary components and calculation methods apply to leave encashments.
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation method that applies daily deductions to monthly employee payroll
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay rate by dividing salary by actual working days, and generate the payroll deduction

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose salary components to include in the calculation.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types eligible for end-of-service encashment. 5. Review which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated by dividing total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days; the leave policy can be calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days); public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from working days to arrive at actual working days

Calculation base options are limited to calendar days (all days in a month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined). Most UAE and KSA companies use 30 custom days to comply with labor law requirements.

Salary component selection is limited to two options: Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method selection is limited to three options: Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days. Configuration applies to individual leave types for end-of-service calculations.
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; calculation method and day type must be selected when configuring the policy

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must reject existing transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be considered and subtracted from the working days when calculating daily pay; for example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with a 22-day working day policy, daily pay is calculated based on 20 days instead of 22 days

Calendar days vary by month (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), which affects daily wage calculations. Different calculation bases produce different daily wage rates and impact final salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts.
Super admins should be aware that their leave encashment policy configurations will overwrite existing eligible paid leave-type policies, which are visible in the configuration interface.

Multiple calculation method options are available (Basic Only and Basic + Allowances) and multiple day calculation types (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days), requiring careful selection based on organizational policy

When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, the Super admin must reject those transactions with prorated salaries before saving changes to salary proration settings.

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: Interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and integrates with leave management and employee record systems to access leave requests and salary information

The Daily Wage Calculator directly impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It interacts with the company's public holiday calendar configuration and payroll processing systems.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies and ensure accurate end-of-service benefit calculations.
Interacts with the payroll system to apply daily unpaid leave deductions to monthly employee pay; part of the broader Leave Policies configuration system
Interacts with the Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions; impacts employee first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: the calculated per-day salary amount used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed as Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) divided by Number of actual working days in the month ; Actual working days: the number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays; differs from total working days if holidays fall within the month ; Unpaid leave: employee absence for which no salary is paid; the daily wage calculator determines the deduction amount based on the number of unpaid leave days

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month. Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays. Custom days: company-defined calculation base allowing flexibility to align with company policies and labor law.

Leave encashment: The conversion of unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: The final settlement of employee benefits upon separation from employment. Daily Wage Calculator: A configuration tool for customizing leave encashment calculations. Salary components: Elements of compensation (Basic, Allowances) used in calculations. Calculation method: The basis for computing daily wages (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days).

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deductions based on daily wage; Calendar days: Deduction based on all days including weekends; Working days: Deduction based on business days only; Custom days: User-defined day calculation method

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: custom days, calendar days, or working days—the three methods for determining prorated salary amounts.
